bibl.title: More Evidence for the Date of Palladas.
bibl.note: P.CtYBR [= P. Yale] Inv. 4000 (= M.-P.3 1333.01; LDAB 145316). We now have two relevant and incontrovertible termini ante/post quos among Palladas' epigrams in the Anthology. AP 11.378 was composed between 331 and 369 (but probably on the earlier end). Meanwhile, AP 6.85 cannot postdate the 320s (and may well have been composed decades earlier).
bibl.seg: Kevin W. Wilkinson, More Evidence for the Date of Palladas.

P.CtYBR [= P. Yale] Inv. 4000 (= M.-P.3 1333.01; LDAB 145316). We now have two relevant and incontrovertible termini ante/post quos among Palladas' epigrams in the Anthology. AP 11.378 was composed between 331 and 369 (but probably on the earlier end). Meanwhile, AP 6.85 cannot postdate the 320s (and may well have been composed decades earlier).
